page.title: 01A view of the Manxey Level.
page.content: The rectangle which we have surveyed lies west of{Normans' Bay}and extends north of{Pevensey,}the landing site of {William the Conqueror.}The area is very sparsely populated. There are two farms north and south of the western side and a little modern development in the south-eastern side. Two main roads run from{Pevensey}to the north and north-east, and there are also two subsidiary roads. The area is flat{ {grassland}with few trees and criss-crossed by man-made dykes and irrigation channels to aid drainage. To the north we can see the hills where{Wartling}stands. In C340 A.D. this whole area lay under the sea with {Chilley}as an island, in fact ships came up to{Pevensey Castle.}The medieval village of{Northeye,}which no longer exists, was an island, there are also many sites of{saltworks.
